directions: Plant the cinnamon tree sapling in a large pot or directly in the ground in a warm, tropical climate.
Water the tree regularly and ensure it receives sufficient sunlight for 2 years to allow it to grow and mature.
Harvest the cinnamon bark from the tree trunk. Use a sharp knife to carefully peel off the outer bark layer.
Allow the bark strips to dry in the sun for a few weeks until they become dry and brittle.
Grind the dry cinnamon bark into a fine powder using a mortar and pestle or a spice grinder.
Store the homemade cinnamon powder in an airtight container in a cool, dry place.
